title: Rough Housing
description: Cindy decides not to attend the Harvest Ball when Blair intimates that because of her tomboyishness she might be a lesbian.

title: Like Mother, Like Daughter
description: Blair fears she will get a reputation for being "easy" because her multiple-divorce' mother is caught flirting with another student's married father.

title: The Return of Mr. Garrett
description: Mrs. Garrett accepts her ex-husband's proposal of remarriage, but changes her mind when she discovers he is teaching the girls how to gamble.

title: I.Q.
description: When Tootie stumbles upon elementary school IQ results ordered by their headmaster, the girls are stunned to find out that their scores don't necessarily match their current academic reputation.

title: Overachieving
description: Tootie's father thinks Mrs. Garrett's influence over his daughter is holding her back. Tootie's latest ambition? To open a beauty salon!

title: Emily Dickinson
description: Blair plagiarizes an Emily Dickinson poem about beauty, but gets caught when the headmaster submits it into a competition, and it wins.

title: Dieting
description: Sue Ann goes on a crash diet after the pressure of everyone's body-consciousness, and Blairs intimating that a boy won't like her, makes her feel fat.

title: The Facts of Love
description: To the chagrin of the headmaster, Mrs. Garrett holds a sex education class. Meanwhile Blair gets into a compromising situation with a boy and has to make a tough decision.

title: Flash Flood
description: During a serious flood Blair and Tootie get trapped in the school stables. The headmaster rescues them and Blair develops a case of hero worship which she mistakes for love.

title: Adoption
description: Blair noses into Natalie's business and arranges for her to talk to her birth mother by phone.

title: Running
description: The headmaster pits two of the girls against each other in a track competition, which causes conflicts.

title: Molly's Holiday
description: Molly's upset that her parents are getting a divorce, so the girls decide to try and get them back together. But her father shows up with "someone".

title: Dope
description: Blair gets Sue Ann into a clique known as "The Group," whose members are all marijuana smokers.

title: The New Girl: Part 1
description: A new student, Jo Polniaczek, arrives at Eastland.

title: The New Girl: Part 2
description: The girls are put on probation and must work in the cafeteria to pay off their damages.

title: Double Standard
description: Blair is shocked when her boyfriend invites Jo to a cotillion at a country club.

title: Who Am I?
description: Tootie falls for a black boy who tries to drive a wedge between her and her white friends.

title: Cousin Geri
description: Blair's cousin Geri, a comedian who has Cerebral Palsy, comes to visit.

title: Shoplifting
description: Mrs. Garrett's birthday is coming up, and when Jo can't afford a present for her, she decides to steal one.

title: Teenage Marriage: Part 1
description: Jo's boyfriend Eddie goes AWOL from his Naval base in Chicago to propose marriage.

title: Teenage Marriage: Part 2
description: Mrs. Garrett tries to stop Jo and Eddie from driving to West Virginia to get married.

title: Gossip
description: Tootie's gossiping causes a rift between Blair, Jo, and Nancy, and almost costs Mrs. Garrett her job.

title: Breaking Point
description: Blair gets involved in a tough campaign for class president but things take a serious turn when one of the girls commits suicide.

title: Sex Symbol
description: A boy with whom Natalie studies spreads rumors about their friendship that damage her reputation while supposedly helping his own.

title: The Secret
description: Jo is up for the Best New Student of the Year award, but her joy is dampened by a letter from her father. She never told anyone that he is in the State Penitentiary for burgling the warehouse where he once worked.

title: Bought and Sold
description: Blair is selling Countess Calvert cosmetics, and she uses Natalie as a model.

title: Pretty Babies
description: Tootie is lured into doing a photo shoot for a child pornographer.

title: Free Spirit
description: Mrs. Garrett's son Alex visits her at Eastland. Natalie is impressed by his claims of having played on several recording sessions for popular musicians, but Blair doesn't trust him.

title: Brian and Sylvia
description: Tootie's uncle Brian and aunt Sylvia are a mixed couple -- he's white and she's black. When Tootie and Natalie visit them in Buffalo, Sylvia receives a job offer in New York City.

title: Growing Pains
description: Blair brings home a bottle of a fine European wine, and Tootie drinks it to show how "adult" she is.

title: Fear Strikes Back
description: Natalie withdraws from her life after an attempted sexual assault.

title: A Baby in the House
description: Blair's friend Allison disappears after visiting, leaving her baby in the girls' care.

title: A Friend in Deed
description: Blair's mother arrives on a surprise visit and Blair is ecstatic until dire news is revealed about her mother's health.

title: Front Page
description: In an article for the school newspaper Jo reports that her journalism teacher, Mr. Gideon, whom she thinks dislikes her, was arrested in a cocaine raid.

title: Give and Take
description: Mrs. Garrett must take a second job at the Howard Johnson's when she loses her pension. This takes a toll on her mood and her Eastland work, so she must choose between the two.

title: Sweet Sorrow
description: Jo's boyfriend Eddie returns just as she is partnered with another boy, Bob, in a marriage study group. Jo soon starts to take more of an interest in him beyond their studies, but this bothers her because of her loyalty to Eddie.

title: From Russia with Love
description: Natalie's Grandma Mona, a Russian Jewish immigrant, comes to visit her.

title: Dear Me
description: Tootie wants to impress the older girls who are going on a camping trip with some boys from Bates. She types a phony love letter from a camp counselor at the summer camp she attended.

title: Cousin Geri Returns
description: Mr. Palmer, the French teacher, asks Geri out on a date. She seems to be having a good time, but Blair believes the man has an ulterior motive for taking her cousin out.

title: Legacy
description: Blair learns that her late grandfather, whom she idealized, was a supporter and benefactor of the Ku Klux Klan.

title: Green-Eyed Monster
description: When Tootie beats Natalie for the lead role in the school play, a rift grows between the two of them.

title: The Americanization of Miko
description: A Japanese student's father objects to her daughter's adoption of Western cultural values.

title: The Marriage Brokers
description: Blair goes on a double date with Mrs. Garrett and her longtime friend Ernest Melbourne, worrying that the two of them might get married.

title: Starstruck
description: Tootie, is fan club president, for pop star Jermaine Jackson. Jo, on the other hand, was preparing for a fundraiser, which was on the same night, of the concert. Blair, however, turned down a date for the fundraiser. Tootie, tearfully begs Mrs. Garrett, to take her to the concert.

title: The Four Musketeers
description: The girls start to become annoyed by each other's little personality quirks. When Mrs. Garrett tells them they've paid off their damages to the school van, they decide to go their separate ways.

title: The Affair
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls spend an afternoon in New York City, where they go to Pagliacci's, a high-profile Italian restaurant. Natalie is devastated when she sees her father kissing another woman across the dining room.

title: Runaway
description: Even though her parents refused to give her permission to go with Mrs. Garrett and the older girls, Tootie runs away to New York to meet up with them. There, she meets a teenage prostitute who tries to recruit her into her line of work.

title: New York, New York
description: Blair and Jo go to visit old friends in New York, where they find that things have changed considerably.

title: Kids Can Be Cruel
description: During the preparations for a box lunch charity auction, the girls are gazing over an Eastland/Bates "Slam Book", in which those writing the comments are identified by numbers instead of names. Mrs. Garrett is horrified by the cruel comments in there. When Blair reveals to one of the Bates boys that Natalie is number 10, Natalie gets her revenge by telling a Bates boy named Carl Price, whom the other boys tease because of his severe acne, which of the box lunches belongs to Blair.

title: Mind Your Own Business
description: Natalie institutes nine rules of privacy after she learns that Blair looked in her diary.

title: The Academy
description: The girls go to a school dance with boys from nearby Stone Military Academy.

title: Jo's Cousin
description: Jo visits her relatives in New Jersey, where her tomboyish 14-year-old cousin Terry puts on a dress and makeup to impress a boy.

title: Read No Evil
description: When the school library institutes a censorship policy, Natalie is bounced from the school paper for speaking out against it, and Mrs. Garrett is asked by Mr. Parker not to comment on the issue.

title: Ain't Miss Beholden
description: Due to budget cuts at Eastland, Jo will lose her scholarship. With a deadline to find another at the end of the week, she is excited to find the one for which she qualifies--until she discovers that it's funded by Blair's family.

title: The Source
description: Natalie fabricates a story about an unnamed Eastland student who had an abortion.

title: The Sound of Silence
description: Tootie refuses to believe she is suffering from hearing loss until she is in an accident.

title: The Oldest Living Graduate
description: Eastland's oldest living graduate returns to the school.

title: Different Drummer
description: Blair befriends a mentally handicapped artist.

title: Dearest Mommie
description: Natalie finally uncovers the name of her biological mother.

title: A Woman's Place
description: While working at a garage, Jo receives a promotion after impressing her boss. However, this causes a rift between her and Doug, her boyfriend and coworker.

title: Daddy's Girl
description: When an IRS agent pays her a visit, Blair discovers that her father has been using her for a string of potentially illegal tax dodges.

title: The Big Fight
description: Natalie covers a boxing match at Bates Academy, the nearby boys' school, for the school paper.

title: For the Asking
description: Natalie refuses to go to the Sadie Hawkins Day dance.

title: September Song
description: Mrs. Garrett receives a marriage proposal from her elderly boyfriend.

title: A Royal Pain
description: An obnoxious young heiress enrolls at Eastland.

title: Magnificent Obsession
description: Jo is concerned by Blair's infatuation with a boy who treats her poorly.

title: Under Pressure
description: When Mrs. Garrett learns she has high blood pressure, the girls try to protect her from stress.

title: Teacher's Pet
description: Jo learns that her favorite teacher is terminally ill.

title: Let's Party
description: Tootie defends her brother Marshall after he drives the girls home from a party after having five beers.

title: Best Sister: Part 1
description: Blair's sister Meg, a nun, inspires Jo.

title: Best Sister: Part 2
description: Blair belittles Jo for wanting to become a nun.

title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?
description: Mrs. Garrett's cooking instructor from Paris visits Eastland. Meanwhile, the girls try to deal with a squirrel who got into their bedroom.

title: Who's on First
description: When Natalie starts spending all her free time with a boy she likes, Tootie gets so jealous that when she picks up a call from him about their upcoming study date, she lies to Natalie and tells her that he canceled it.

title: Help from Home
description: Both Blair and Jo are accepted to the prestigious Langley College, however Jo decides she's not going because of the cost and the financial burden it would put on her mother, who is already working multiple jobs just to put Jo through Eastland. Her mother and father, however, are adamant about her attending. Their assertion is that they will somehow come up with the money because Jo's future is their most valuable asset.

title: Take My Finals, Please
description: The girls study for final exams together for the very last time.

title: Graduation: Part 1
description: In the days leading up to graduation, Mrs. Garrett becomes overworked because Mr. Parker has put her in charge of the entire ceremony, while Tootie worries whether she'll see Blair and Jo again. Meanwhile, Jo, who has to give the class valediction, is under additional pressure because of her parents' fighting, while Blair's father is unable to come to the ceremony, making her mother angry.

title: Graduation: Part 2
description: Before Jo and Blair graduate, Tootie and Natalie want to preserve as much time with them as possible, still fearing they'll never be together again. Meanwhile Jo's father tries to mend a rift with his mother.

title: Brave New World: Part 1
description: As Blair and Jo enter Langley college, Mrs. Garrett decides to quit her job at Eastland.

title: Brave New World: Part 2
description: Mrs. Garrett decides to open a gourmet delicatessen and asks the girls to assist her.

title: Gamma Gamma or Bust
description: Blair is nominated for a placement in the Gamma Gamma sorority at Langley.

title: Just My Bill
description: When Jo finds out her new boyfriend is the son of distinguished and wealthy parents, she feels uncomfortable continuing the relationship.

title: What Price Glory?
description: Tootie discovers that her boyfriend Jeff, a school athlete, cannot read.

title: The Halloween Show
description: The girls fear Mrs. Garrett ground up a missing customer into her homemade bratwurst!

title: Advance Placement
description: Natalie is allowed to take a course at Langley and gets so caught up in the social life of college that she begins skipping classes at Eastland and work at Edna's Edibles.

title: I'm Dancing as Fast as I Can
description: Blair and Jo take Mrs. Garrett to a male strip club for her birthday, where Blair discovers a shocking revelation about her boyfriend.

title: Small But Dangerous
description: Kelly begs for a fresh start from Mrs. Garrett and the girls when her attempt to extort money from Edna's Edibles is thwarted by Jo.

title: Store Games
description: Kelly informs Mrs. Garrett that Pete, the underhanded owner of Pete's Deli, is aiming to put Edna's Edibles out of business by selling gourmet food at a discount. While Mrs. Garrett gets worried, Jo gets devious and uses the store's computer to mess with the files in Pete's computer.

title: The Second Time Around
description: Jo thinks her father's intentions to remarry means that her parents are reconciling.

title: The Christmas Show
description: The girls prepare to go their separate ways for Christmas vacation.

title: The Chain Letter
description: All four girls are fired from Edna's Edibles by Mrs. Garrett. They hope she'll give them a second chance.

title: Next Door
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls befriend a little boy whose single mother doesn't have time to take care of him.

title: Crossing the Line
description: Natalie and Tootie's relationship is strained when Tootie questions Natalie's reasons for refusing and then accepting a date with Tootie's cousin Michael.

title: A Death in the Family
description: Natalie's father dies from a sudden heart attack.

title: Big Fish/Little Fish
description: Blair is confused as to why she isn't as popular at Langley as she was at Eastland and needs Jo's help to turn things around. Natalie has stopped having fun since the death of her father so Tootie and Mrs. Garrett try to help her get over it.

title: Star at Langley
description: Blair encourages Cliff to have a more open and less demanding relationship with her. But she quickly changes her mind when the first person Cliff starts seeing is Heather Hunt, a Hollywood movie star who is visiting Langley.

title: Dream Marriage
description: Blair dreams of what her life might be like in the year 2000.

title: Mother and Daughter
description: Tootie's mother is visiting her in Peekskill and feels compelled to confront her on why she doesn't confide in her about anything.

title: Seems Like Old Times
description: Eddie, Jo's old flame, returns to rekindle their romance, even though he's married to another woman.

title: Joint Custody
description: If Mrs. Garrett doesn't save her son's troubled marriage, Edna's Edibles might be sold off in the divorce.

title: The Way We Were: Part 1
description: As the girls prepare for their summer vacations, they look back on the past, as seen in clips from previous episodes.

title: The Way We Were: Part 2
description: The girls continue their reminiscences of their friendship.

title: The Summer of '84
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls return home to tell each other about their respective summer vacations.

title: Love at First Byte
description: Natalie secretly signs Blair and Jo up in a computer dating service, hoping to get information she can use in a term paper.

title: Taking a Chance on Love: Part 1
Taking a Chance on Love: Part 2
Dear Apple
description: When Jo and Blair have been a each other's throats because of a misunderstanding. Jo who's working on the computer activates it to converse with her. So she talks about what happened between her and Blair and what should she do.

title: Talk, Talk, Talk
description: The girls fill in as disk jockeys at the Langley College radio station.

title: The Rich Aren't Different
description: Blair takes Jo to small claims court over a broken wristwatch.

title: Christmas in the Big House
description: Blair plans a charity event at what she believes is an orphanage but is really a prison.

title: Me and Eleanor
description: Tootie portrays Eleanor Roosevelt in a play.

title: With a Little Help from My Friends
Gone with the Wind: Part 1
description: The girls spend spring break in Florida when a hurricane hits.

title: Man in the Attic
description: Kevin moves into the attic and quickly becomes a nuisance to the girls.

title: The Last Drive-In
description: The girls write a petition to save a dilapidated drive-in movie theater but find little interest from anyone else..

title: Sisters
description: Blair's mother and Jo's father go out on a date.

title: Bus Stop
description: When Natalie graduates from Eastland, she shocks her mother and her friends by deciding not to go to college.

title: The Interview Show
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls are interviewed for a documentary about Eastland Academy.

title: Out of the Fire...
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls return home from summer vacation to find that their home and business have been destroyed by a fire.

title: Into the Frying Pan
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls decide to rebuild their store into an update version of a 1950s malt shop. Mrs. Garrett hires a good-looking young carpenter, named George Burnett, to help out, but who causes more of a distraction to the rest of the ladies.

title: Grand Opening
description: Mrs. Garrett and the girls open a novelty shop called "Over Our Heads."

title: Teacher, Teacher
description: Jo works as a substitute teacher at an elementary school.

title: Men for All Seasons
description: The store gets into hot water with Langley officials for carrying a beefcake poster featuring the men's swimming team.

title: A New Life
description: Monica reveals to Blair that she is pregnant by her soon-to-be-ex-husband.

title: Doo-Wah
description: The girls go to an audition to perform as backup singers for El DeBarge.

title: Come Back to the Truck Stop, Natalie Green, Natalie Green
description: Natalie is in a truck stop diner in Pennsylvania where she writes a story, relating the characters in it to the people in her own life.

title: Born Too Late
description: Tootie helps Andy prepare for an audition for a play.
Jo handcuffs herself to Blair, who has to anchor the Langley TV station's newscast.

title: Ballroom Dance
description: Jo,hesitantly,takes up ballroom dancing. Discovering,to her surprise,that she likes it more than she thought she would but seemingly shrugging it off when her friends ask about her interest in it. Quote: "I'm just doing it for exercise".

title: Christmas Baby
description: Blair's mother goes into labor on Christmas Eve.

title: Tootie Drives
description: Mrs. Garrett tutors Tootie for a driving test.

title: The Agent
description: Tootie serves as an agent to an aspiring comedian trying to get a TV gig.

title: Atlantic City
description: The girls' trip to Atlantic City reunites Jo with Flyman, the aspiring singer she met in Florida.

title: The Lady Who Came to Dinner
description: An elderly song-and-dance woman hired for Blair's birthday party stays with the girls.

title: The Candidate
description: Natalie runs for mayor to stop a tacky amusement park from being built. Blair, however, is campaigning for her opponent.

title: Big Time Charlie
description: Jo's father, Charlie Polniaczek, believes that has made a fortune in citrus futures. Meanwhile, Natalie returns from a trip to Miami and has brought back the wrong suitcase.

title: The Graduate
description: It's Graduation Day at Eastland, but Tootie would rather audition for the lead role in a musical play than continue her education.

title: Out of Peekskill: Part 1
description: Mrs. Garrett becomes reacquainted with Bruce Gaines, a man she met when she was serving in the Peace Corps. He proposes marriage to her, and she accepts. Her sister, Beverly Ann Stickle, comes to the wedding in her Winnebago recreational vehicle.

title: Out of Peekskill: Part 2
description: In spite of a scare at Depressed Person's Cliff, Mrs. Garrett and Bruce are married, and they rejoin the Peace Corps. Beverly Ann takes over her duties at Over Our Heads.

title: Off-Broadway Baby
description: Tootie goes to audition for a Broadway show. When she learns that another girl is not only going to sing the song she intends to sing but is better than her. One of the persons who's auditioning tells Tootie to sabotage her which she reluctantly does.

title: The Little Chill
description: Three of the girls who used to live in the dorm with Blair, Tootie, and Natalie return for a reunion. Jo feels left out because she never knew them.

title: Fast Food
description: Natalie hires Blair as an employee at the Mexican restaurant Señor Sombrero, where she is assistant manager.

title: Where's Poppa?
description: Blair's father is charged with insider trading and when he pleads guilty, she doesn't know how to react.

title: Write and Wrong
description: Beverly Ann helps Natalie confront Andy's grandmother for plagiarizing one of her stories.

title: Seven Little Indians
description: On a dark and stormy night, the girls and their friends all meet with gruesome ends.

title: A Winter's Tale
description: The girls go to a ski resort.

title: 62 Pick Up
description: A flashback to the early 1960s, replete with teen idols, beatniks, and girl groups.

title: Boy About the House
description: When Andy's parents break up, Beverly Ann decides it is time to adopt him.

title: Ex Marks the Spot
description: Just as things between Beverly Ann and Oliver are progressing. Her ex-husband Frank shows up. He starts to tell her something which she at first thinks is his desire to reconcile but he has a heart attack. At the hospital she learns what he was trying to tell her is that someone wants to buy their old house and that he has remarried.

title: Down and Out in Malibu: Part 1
Down and Out in Malibu: Part 2
description: Richard Moll has the girls put in prison when he sees what has happened to his house.

title: Rumor Has It
description: Blair starts law school. She spends a lot of time with her law professor. While the two of them are in his office talking, his wife comes in and assumes that they're "together". So word gets around about Blair and her professor. She considers dropping out.

title: Before the Fall
description: Natalie's been given an assignment to do an article on the ROTC. Natalie gets close to a cadet. Later when they get a new drill sergeant, they learn that they're going sky diving which makes Natalie nervous. She has to decide if she wants to stick with it or drop out when the cadet she got close to will.

title: Sweet Charity
description: Jo's looking for a job. She finds one at a community center but unfortunately the center is strapped financially so she's not getting paid. And she clashes with the guy who runs the center.

title: Up from Down Under
description: Pippa McKenna, a teenage girl from Eastland's Australian sister school, Colunga Academy, enrolls at Eastland.

title: The More the Marrier
description: With Tootie's boyfriend, Jeff, away she gets asked by another guy to go out on a date. At first, she doesn't want to because it might seem she's stepping out on Jeff. But Blair convinces her to. And on the night they're suppose to go out, Jeff shows up. And Natalie's boyfriend, Snake finally shows up.

title: A Rose by Any Other Age
Adventures in Baileysitting
description: Blair's baby sister Bailey gets lost while in the girls' care.

title: It's a Wonderful Christmas
description: Beverly Ann feels unwanted at Christmas and wonders what it would be like if she had never come to Peekskill.

title: Golden Oldies
description: The girls imagine what their lives will be like 50 years into the future.

title: A Thousand Frowns
description: Andy meets a guy at the youth center where Jo works and starts hanging with him. But when they learn the guy spends him time goofing around and appears not be doing anything with his life and Andy starts to act like him, they think he shouldn't hang with Andy anymore. They learn that he thinks he's going to die on his 30th birthday like so many others in his family. They tell him that he's an idiot. Later Casey tells Jo she's being irresponsible because there people who thought they were going to die and do. So she asks the guy to spend his birthday with them.

title: Something in Common
description: Jo is dating Rick, when she introduces him to her father. He is not impressed by him because of his playful attitude.

title: Peekskill Law
description: Blair interns at a law firm and learns that her law professor who resigned because it was assumed that they were having an affair, works there. He asks her to help her with the case, he's working on, which is defending a man who's accused of murder. She brings him and everybody acts nervous around him. Later Blair comes up with a strategy for the trial.

title: The First Time
description: Natalie goes to bed with her boyfriend, Snake.

title: Let's Face the Music
description: A slip-up at a beauty parlor turns Jo's hair blonde and Blair's hair green, causing problems at a banquet. Meanwhile, Pippa's band is scheduled to perform at that same banquet.

title: Big Apple Blues
description: Natalie finds an apartment in the Soho district of New York, living with several eccentric characters.

title: The Beginning of the End
description: When Blair discovers that Eastland Academy is in dire financial straits, she decides not to go to law school but buy it and save it from closing.

title: The Beginning of the Beginning
description: When Blair decides to make some changes to Eastland to save it. Things don't get off to a good start. She also has to deal with a student who seems intent on getting kicked out. Blair tries to find out why.
